A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: This movie had the opposite problem than TFA: it tried to be shocking with ridiculous twists just for the sake of it. It was full of sloppy mischaracterizations\, dropped or poorly resolved sub-plots\, disjointed continuity with TFA and the other films\, bad music\, jarring tonal shifts\, and a boring main character. Further\, the new movies did not need to destroy the past in order to move on. There is a balance to be struck between being ossified by history / tradition and discarding everything. The past can be a great foundation and springboard to leap forward.
